channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Novak Djokovic has had his share of on-court implosions, but Sunday at Wimbledon versus Nick Kyrgios, he was a picture of serenity–and won his 21st major tournament title, writes @jasongay https://t.co/oDZevaNulm

Since the pandemic began, workers and employers moved from Democratic-leaning states to Republican-leaning ones in the middle of the country and Florida, spurring faster economic recoveries there #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/UXakS2yamO https://t.co/oMd1A6NIaW
Forget beaches. Miami is all about hedge funds and crypto now. https://t.co/ZgOwixiDM9

Sri Lanka’s president and prime minister agreed to resign after protesters stormed and occupied the president’s residence, amid public anger over the country’s deepening sovereign debt crisis https://t.co/Mc21c7wnm1
NASA released a dazzling test image taken by the James Webb Space Telescope in advance of Tuesday's unveiling of its first full-color scientific images https://t.co/oAXBT6iVmk

Moguls including Bill Gates, Warren Buffett and Sheryl Sandberg have gathered in Sun Valley, Idaho for the annual "summer camp for billionaires." Take a peek at their laid back style. https://t.co/GArdVDFFpW
Protests in Sri Lanka, which forced out the president and prime minister, signal tough choices ahead for other countries with high debt and shortages of food and energy https://t.co/6oWdWI65yl

French President Emmanuel Macron is proposing $20 billion in new measures to blunt the impact of higher prices on households. Inflation remains lower in France than in the U.S. and most other European countries. https://t.co/wvSHQBx615
The pandemic and supply-chain meltdown have made businesses—from beauty companies and auto makers to retailers and small firms—rethink low-cost importing from China https://t.co/ey86L7rnEj
Elon Musk’s showdown with Twitter has set the stage for what could become one of the most unusual courtroom battles in corporate-takeover history https://t.co/IJTDNeK77R

Steve Bannon, former adviser to President Donald Trump, has told the committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol that he is willing to testify, reversing course as he faced trial for contempt https://t.co/psSMojm0GK
Plunging shares in Tesla and a darkening outlook for social-media companies made the $44 billion deal less appealing over time https://t.co/DlxdSjGIuc

Elon Musk’s decision to try to walk away from his $44 billion acquisition of Twitter after weeks of criticizing the company leaves the bruised social-media platform reeling in the midst of an already challenging period https://t.co/ky3uC1qgei
Novak Djokovic has won Wimbledon for the fourth straight time, defeating Nick Kyrgios in the men's final to notch his 21st Grand Slam title https://t.co/RpzfbmosYK

Unable or unwilling to stomach higher prices, many Americans are skipping some purchases and outings—even the smallest luxuries. “I kind of second guess if I really needed to get this extra pack of chips.” https://t.co/HtLNfUuLdr
Three years ago, Anna Weyant’s drawings were selling for $400 on the beach. Now the 27-year-old is an art star whose paintings sold for nearly $4 million combined at auction. https://t.co/wPVrQTlTGX
Vladimir Putin has made clear that he has imperial designs beyond Ukraine. Will he act on them? https://t.co/27T6XJsRx9
Stressed out? Sleep deprived? Sad? You may need a good cry. https://t.co/STnxu5qQ4b
Natalie Portman's jacked shoulders and arms in "Thor: Love and Thunder" show this summer’s new beauty standard https://t.co/pX8z8xn78s

From @WSJopinion: Nearly 600,000 Covid deaths have occurred on President Biden’s watch despite vaccines and better treatments. One lesson is the importance of diverse opinions. Another lesson is that science evolves, writes @AllysiaFinley. https://t.co/X2y4je1r1p
Pickleball is booming, and that includes the sound. Nearby neighbors are furious. https://t.co/x4T9Qxr8Kw
Piles of lost bags in London, Paris and Toronto: Here’s why more checked luggage is going missing this summer https://t.co/jhZfDcRyVr

Japan voted in a parliamentary election that politicians on all sides said would demonstrate the nation’s commitment to democracy after the killing of former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe https://t.co/QJd8O54QM1
Air New Zealand plans to introduce pods with flat beds in economy class, initially installing them on direct flights to Chicago and New York from Auckland https://t.co/dASW1BN7xN
Elon Musk, Twitter set for legal slugfest after billionaire moved to back out of $44 billion purchase of social-media platform https://t.co/uQ458n0K6n
Heard on the Street: A settlement between Elon Musk and Twitter would beat a protracted legal battle, but the social network will still have to contend with the aftermath https://t.co/4JbT5cozYg
Many Russian tanks have a design feature that leads them to explode on the battlefield. Watch how that vulnerability impacts Russia’s campaign in Ukraine. https://t.co/3WgFQUDpsH
By many measures, the economies of red states have bounced back from the pandemic faster than blue ones. Migration patterns help explain why. https://t.co/IVw3RoRevU
Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has agreed to resign, according to the parliament’s speaker https://t.co/wkEOj2WyXl
Forget beaches. Miami is all about hedge funds and crypto now. https://t.co/NgCKGxzXp6
The number of U.S. residents in Portugal leaped last year. Here's why so many Americans are relocating there. https://t.co/KjuKZ2z4LZ
Republicans are favored to take control of the House in this year’s midterms, and redistricting has given them a built-in advantage that could span the next 10 years https://t.co/Xza1gbha1f
Our reporter drove from New Orleans to Chicago and back to test the feasibility of taking a road trip in an EV. She wouldn’t do it again soon. https://t.co/mTWzoQRTBx
Bill Gates said he thinks cryptocurrencies and NFTs are “100%” based on the greater fool theory https://t.co/7OpnJvqHRp
Elena Rybakina defeated Ons Jabeur in the Wimbledon women's final. She is the first tennis player representing Kazakhstan to win a major title. https://t.co/Cz8vg2U1Zx
The Las Vegas Raiders have named Sandra Douglass Morgan president, making her the first Black woman to hold that role in the National Football League https://t.co/wVLwKlGXrG
Inflation-protected U.S. savings bonds are yielding an eye-popping 9.62%—if you can fight through the red tape to actually buy one https://t.co/zRuYwvI8op
Essay: Buying brides is an illegal but long-held practice in China. A video of a woman chained in a shed has brought it to light—and spurred a campaign to stamp it out. https://t.co/hlLTQ5444S

A superyacht reportedly being built for Amazon founder Jeff Bezos won’t be able to sail through the waterways of the Dutch port city of Rotterdam after the company making the vessel withdrew a request to dismantle a historic bridge amid public outcry https://t.co/wTuXr0u4GJ
The U.K. is helping Ukraine turn civilians into soldiers, training new recruits to give Kyiv more manpower along the eastern front with Russia https://t.co/R3dZoeo21t

Elon Musk got approval to connect his Starlink satellite-internet service to planes and boats, but SpaceX is still sparring with rivals over spectrum it uses to reach customers https://t.co/fHgozNrmrF

Many long Covid sufferers are struggling to make ends meet, despite a strong job market. It’s one reason why the economy might not be able to grow as quickly as it otherwise might. https://t.co/h7lxoTC72d
The assassination of Shinzo Abe—just before lunchtime on a busy street corner—has been met with disbelief in a country where few have ever seen a gun drawn, let alone used one https://t.co/Zk7kJicntK
The euro is hurtling toward parity with the dollar for the first time since its early years of existence https://t.co/lYJrK7izVT
An appeals court tossed a $95 million defamation lawsuit brought by former Alabama Supreme Court Chief Justice Roy Moore against comedian Sacha Baron Cohen https://t.co/bB5p9nS9sm
NASA released a dazzling test image taken by the James Webb Space Telescope in advance of next week’s unveiling of its first full-color scientific images https://t.co/qI56xRmqS2
Twitter’s board says it plans to pursue legal action after Elon Musk said he is seeking to terminate their $44 billion deal https://t.co/yvNebytNpp
Buying a home in America is the least affordable it has been since 2006, new data show https://t.co/vojO39Tv0X
A new Arizona state law will make recording an officer within 8 feet a misdemeanor offense in most instances https://t.co/LgbfMoHFbt
NASA released a dazzling test image taken by the James Webb Space Telescope in advance of next week’s unveiling of its first full-color scientific images https://t.co/tZ64bAVcAb
